Require("levels/lib/ant.lua") Require("levels/lib/natmaze.lua")
-- i took these from Nat Pryce's natmaze.lua maps function cell_to_level( cellx, celly ) return originx + cellx * 2, originy + celly * 2 end
function render_cell(maze, cellx, celly) x,y = cell_to_level(cellx, celly)
_n = maze:can_go_north(cellx,celly) _s = maze:can_go_south(cellx,celly) _e = maze:can_go_east(cellx,celly) _w = maze:can_go_west(cellx,celly)
if _s then cells["|"](x, y+1) end
if _e then cells["-"](x+1, y) end
if ( _n and _s and not _e and not _w ) then cells["|"](x, y) elseif ( not _n and not _s and _e and _w ) then cells["-"](x, y) else cells[" "](x, y) end end
-- to get the size of maze originx, originy = nil, nil mazew, mazeh = nil, nil
function get_limits(x,y) originx = originx or x originy = originy or y
if (x>originx) then mazew = ceil((x-originx+1)/2) end
if (y>originy) then mazeh = ceil((y-originy+1)/2) end end

cells[" "]=cell{floor="fl-rock"} cells["."]=cell{floor="fl-abyss"} cells["|"]=cell{item="it-vstrip"} cells["-"]=cell{item="it-hstrip"} cells["#"]=cells["."]
cells["o"]=cell{actor={"ac-blackball", {player=0, mouseforce=1}}} cells["Z"]=cell{{{get_limits}}}
